vipdopt.simulation.fdtd.LumericalFDTD¶

class vipdopt.simulation.fdtd.LumericalFDTD¶

Bases: ISolver

Class interfacing with the lumapi FDTD class.

__init__() → None¶

Initialize a LumericalFDTD.

load(path: Path)¶
load(sim: ISimulation)
load(path: Path, sim: ISimulation)
load(path: Path | None, sim: ISimulation | None)

Load a simulation from a Lumerical .fsp file.

load_simulation(sim: ISimulation)¶

Load a simulation into the FDTD solver.

promise_env_setup(**kwargs)¶

Setup the environment settings as soon as the fdtd is instantiated.

reformat_monitor_data(sims: list[LumericalSimulation])¶

Reformat simulation data so it can be loaded independent of the solver.

This method does the following for each provided simulation.

  • Loads the simulation from the path indicated by sim.info[‘path’]

  • Creates a .npz file for each monitor in the simulation, containing all

    of the returned values (E, H, P, T, Source Power)

Arguments:
sims (list[LumericalSimulation]): The simulations to load data from. Must

have the info[‘path’] field populated.

run()¶

Run the FDTD solver.

runjobs(option: int = 1)¶

Run all simulations in the job queue.

Arguments:
option (int): Indicates the resources to use when runnin simulations.

0: Run jobs in single process mode using only the local machine. 1: Run jobs using the resources and parallel settings specified in

the resource manager. (default)

save(path: Path)¶
save(path: Path, sim: ISimulation)

Save a LumericalSimulation using the FDTD solver software.

set_resource(resource_num: int, resource: str, value: Any)¶

Set the specified job manager resource for this simulation.

setup_env_resources(**kwargs)¶

Configure the environment resources for running this simulation.

**kwargs:

mpi_exe (Path): Path to the mpi executable to use nprocs (int): The number of processes to run the simulation with hostfile (Path | None): Path to a hostfile for running distributed jobs solver_exe (Path): Path to the fdtd-solver to run nsims (int): The number of simulations being run

transmission(monitor_name: str) → ndarray[Any, dtype[_ScalarType_co]]¶

Return the transmission as a function of wavelength.
